I enter username, email address, and password. It's all good until I press DONE, at which point it "checks password" until the no go message comes up. Win11, new Dell desktop. I can't fix this. If you can, please tell me how. Thanks -- Paul.

title: Thunderbird Email Presentation Problem after updating.
content:
After updating to latest Thunderbird, when I display a received message, the "From:" address has my email account and not who it is from; along with a YELLOW Notation band at the bottom of the message that says "A unique identity matching the from address was not found. The message will be sent using the current From field and settings from identity John Kirkpatrick <jpkirkpatrick@earthlink.net...." The email message is then displayed in what appears to be an email missing the Remote Detail. Why is this being done and how can I just get my Normal Email Display back? </p>

Going through every setting I found the hot-keys "CTRL=O" will open the message in a new tab with the normal Remote Information like it used to do before updating. How can I get that to be the default display of the emails in their list table? Thanks in advance for any assistance you can provide. John Kirkpatrick [ jpkirkpatrick@earthlink.net ]
creator: JPKirkpatrick

title: Why has thunderbird/comcast imap started to time out?
content:
On our Windows computer Thunderbird has always had an issue where it would pop up a message saying "Could not connect to mail server imap.comcast.net, the connection was refused". A few hours or days would go by and Thunderbird and Comcast would talk to each other again. I finally had some time to try and debug this and (of course) I couldn't get the error to reproduce but instead I kept getting an imap timeout error. I captured the error message but it doesn't tell me why it's timing out or what to do about it.

P.S. Yes, I increased the timeout value from 100 to 300 and now it simply takes longer

Details: Windows 10 Home 22H2 Thunderbird 128.3.1esr

Error log: ImapClient.sys.mjs:887:18 19:23:29.582 mailnews.imap.4: NotifyBodysToDownload Array [] ImapClient.sys.mjs:1866:18 19:23:29.582 mailnews.imap.4: GetRunningUrl ImapClient.sys.mjs:1872:18 19:23:29.582 mailnews.imap.4: Done with status=0 ImapClient.sys.mjs:1851:18 19:23:29.583 mailnews.imap.4: C: 51 IDLE ImapClient.sys.mjs:962:20 19:23:29.583 mailnews.imap.4: Idling in imap://<email>@imap.comcast.net/Drafts ImapClient.sys.mjs:829:18 19:23:29.736 mailnews.imap.4: S: + idling

title: Disappearing Inbox folder
content:
I was working on figuring out an imap timeout problem (previous forum question) when I accidentally deleted the Inbox folder. No problem, I thought, cuze imap protocol will recreate that folder when thunderbird restarts. Problem is, it did, but after a period of time (10-15 mins) the Inbox and Trash (which I didn't delete) disappear. Nothing I do seems to recreate them. Message Synchronizing is on and Inbox & Trash are checked. Doesn't matter if unread emails are in there. When I restart thunderbird Inbox and Trash are back but then disappear.

Details: Windows 10 Home 22H2 Thunderbird 128.3.1esr

Error log (I highlighted the interesting parts): ... ImapClient.sys.mjs:887:18 19:28:29.005 mailnews.imap.2: Done with status=0 ImapClient.sys.mjs:1851:18 19:28:29.006 mailnews.imap.2: C: 61 IDLE ImapClient.sys.mjs:962:20 19:28:29.006 mailnews.imap.2: Idling in imap://qaz13579%40comcast.net@imap.comcast.net/INBOX ImapClient.sys.mjs:829:18 19:28:29.176 mailnews.imap.2: S: + idling ... ImapClient.sys.mjs:887:18 19:32:54.970 mailnews.imap.0: discoverAllFolders imap://qaz13579%40comcast.net@imap.comcast.net ImapClient.sys.mjs:179:18 19:32:54.970 mailnews.imap.0: C: 31 LIST (SUBSCRIBED) "" "*" RETURN (SPECIAL-USE) ImapClient.sys.mjs:962:20 19:32:55.135 mailnews.imap.0: S: * LIST (\Subscribed \UnMarked \Drafts) "/" Drafts

title: Cannot send emails with my Hotmail (Outlook Office) account
content:
For mor than a week, it's been impossible to send emails via Thunderbird for my Hotmail account. I always get an error message saying that there's been a connection issue to the SMTP server.

Already checked the online help for SMTP configuration but everything seems OK (see screnshot). The only strange thing is that for the authentification method, there is not the "OAuth2/Modern Aut" option.

Any idea how to solve this issue ?

Couple of notes : 

    - Receiving messages with this hotmail account works perfectly fine.  
    - Sending / receiving emails with a yahoo account works fine
creator: manceau_matthieu

title: infiltrated email
content:
every few days we keep getting all of our emails come through witha picture on them , no writing or sender info this has been happening for months also no' from or to or subjest ' shown when the email is open -

see picture

there seems to be some kind of spam/virus that has ifiltrated all of our website incoming emails.....

please help with identifying and resolving the problem as we can't read customer emails or print orders!

we use several emails which come through on to the same inbox ,these are -

website@inmotiontrials.com info@inmotiontrials.com orders@inmotiontrials.com pete@inmotiontrials.com

pretty sure the problem is affecting either orders@inmotiontrials.com and or website@inmotiontrials.com

if reading these same emails on imap shown on windows mail we do not have a problem at all but we much prefer using thunderbird!!!!

please help!

thanks

Pete
creator: info12009

title: ALTERACIÓN DEL CONTENIDO DE LOS EMAILS QUE RECIBO
content: Buenas: Quería comunicar un problema que me está pasando con los correos electrónicos que recibo en Thunderbird. Tengo tres cuentas en la plataforma y esto me pasa con la cuenta de Gmail. De vez en cuando una serie de correos que recibo, que deberían tener su contenido de texto y adjuntos correspondientes, aparecen vacíos con un archivo mp4 adjunto. Este archivo es el mismo en todos los correos que están vacíos (VID-20190404-WA0001.mp4). Como consecuencia no puedo acceder al contenido de los correos afectados y tengo que ir a la cuenta de Google para poderlos ver correctamente y descargar los adjuntos que me envíen si los tienen. He desinstalado la plataforma la he vuelto a instalar pero los correos aparecen de igual forma, vacíos y con el archivo mp4 adjunto. También he checkeado con antivirus y nada. No sé qué puede estar pasando y me preocupa que se haya visto comprometida la privacidad de mi correo electrónico a través de Thunderbird. No sé si alguien sabe o puede ayudarme con este asunto. Gracias de antemano. PD: No sé si esto tiene algo que ver, pero empezó a ocurrirme lo que comento después de recibir un email de Tendam que Thunderbird no almacenó en Spam. No le di a ningún enlace ni le di a visualizar contenido sabiendo que la empresa sufrió recientemente un ciberataque con robo de datos.
creator: pilarportillo.arq
